title: Rugby World Cup: Japan defeat Scotland, Wales stutter against Uruguay – video highlights
text:
Scotland are out of the Rugby World Cup after a stunning 28-21 win by hosts Japan in Yokohama booked a quarter-final against South Africa.

Japan were 21-7 up at half-time and the Brave Blossoms sealed a bonus point soon after the break with their fourth try. Scotland fought back, but fell well short of the victory they needed to deny Japan a last-eight place.

In Pool D, Wales continued their 100% record with a 35-13 win against Uruguay, who put up stubborn resistance. Warren Gatland’s men will now face France in the quarter-finals. There was also first win for Tonga, who came from behind to beat United States 19-31 in Pool C.
description: Japan reach their first ever World Cup quarter final and Wales clinch top spot in Pool D
